I can say that their room, the Farralon room, is amazing for a corporate party, birthday party etc. It can hold 200 people and has a view of the bay with all of the boats - absolutely amazing. And the staff there are super friendly. If you're looking for a great place to host an event, definitely check out their room!
author: M B.

description: This aquarium was small, but it was fun. I prefer the Monterey Bay Aquarium.
author: Rose S.

description: I am obsessed with finding cool, interesting -- and educational -- things to do with my one-year-old around San Francisco, partly because I go stir crazy if left in house too long with said one-year-old, and partly because I secretly believe that said one-year-old just might be one of the smartest, cutest babies on the entire planet (genius needs be nurtured). That said, one day I braved the tourist infested streets of Pier 39 to check out the Aquarium of the Bay. Since it's part of a vacation hot spot, I was apprehensive and skeptical: How could anything so touristy be cool? But, once inside, I changed my tune. Two 300-foot tunnels built under the bay make it so you're surrounded by fish (I was held completely captivated by a school of shimmery fish swimming in a swirling spiral over my head). Then, on another floor, a series of touch pools presided over by helpful, knowledgeable attendants. So impressive ... I'll be back!  (P.S. The Aquarium of the Bay gets my vote over the California Academy of Sciences Steinhart Aquarium temporarily housed on Howard Street.)
author: Katie B.

description: i thought we were under the bay but we werent. it was just a big tank that makes it like you were. its at groundlevel. it was very small. LBaquarium is bigger and possibly even better.
author: Maria P.

description: This place is really crappy and small.  I don't think the fish are very happy in these environments.  The labels on the displays are SEVERELY lacking.  Totally NOT worth the money.  Tourist trap.
author: FogCity G.

description: This place is teeny tiny!  It's only two floors and the ticket price for an adult is about $14.00 (so not worth it).  BUT, I went on Family Appreciation Day so it was free.  The line to get in was crazy long though.  I haven't decided yet if the line was worth it.  It is very very small, but the tube is really cool.  I love watching the sharks and rays swim over me.  I really liked the touch pools though.  I got to touch bat rays, tiger sharks, star fish, sea urchins, and sea cucumbers.  So cool!  My nephew refused to touch anything because he thought they would bite him.  When he finally decided he wanted to touch a bat ray, none of them would swim close to us anymore.  He claims he had fun though, which is the main point.  I was a little hesitant taking him because we had to wait in that long line and he was wearing his "big boy pants" yesterday instead of his pull-ups.  There's only one set of bathrooms in the place (or only one that I saw) and that would've been major trouble if he decided he needed to pee when we were in the middle of walking through the aquarium.
author: Kris L.

description: Around the holidays my big family went to the Wharf and we weren't sure if we were going to shell out for this. We decided to bring the kids and they thoroughly enjoyed it. Not only is that tunnel super awesome, and folks, you can go around it several times if you want. But the touch tanks are a really cool thing for the kids. I know Monterey has them, but they are always super crowded and there doesn't seem to be as many. I think I liked this one better, even though it was small. They also have a AAA discount.
author: Tricia B.

description: I had fun here. It was no means as big as the monterey bay aquarium, but I still had fun. Price wasn't too bad and the tunnel experience was pretty neat. Good clean family fun.
author: Ro F.

description: For the exact same price ($15), you can have a much more enjoyable time at the SF Zoo.  I spent no more than 25 minutes at the Aquarium!  This place is ridiculously small.  You would think this place was bigger given its proximity to the ocean.  It's a glorified fish tank with little bang for your buck.  I recommend watching a movie with a similar budget - at least you'll be preoccupied for much longer.  Monterey Bay Aquarium is 10 times better than this place.
author: David D.

description: what a rip-off.  so very over-priced, of course they have a big rent to cover and yes, they are non-profit.   we had homerun tickets, otherwise we would never have gone there.  at almost $17.00/adult and you're easily in and out of there in an hour, it's not a very cost effective learning experience, if indeed it is a learning experience
author: Stefanie S.

description: We almost didn't go because of a lot of the negative reviews on yelp. I'm glad we did. Of course, we did get a 50% discount because of our Zoo membership. Otherwise we may have felt ripped of for $15. The aquarium is on the small side and there are essentially three sections: a bunch of smallish tanks, a really cool pair of tunnels that make you feel like you are underwater, and then a "hands-on" group of pools with skates, rays, sharks, etc. It was definitely small but a lot of fun with kids and a pretty nice, low-key way to spend an hour or so.
author: Pablo P.

description: within the first few months when my husband & i used to date, we took a visit here as a mini-getaway from san jose. we had fun because we are definitely animal lovers! it was our first time to an aquarium for the both of us so it was quite interesting...just for the both of us discovering different species was fun because we had each other. as for my opinion, i didn't mind how the place looked like or anything else.. all i caared about was seeing sharks and jellyfishes! the price wasn't too bad.. first time experiences are always fun!
author: princess l.

description: its ok but can be alot better. there were many fish in the main tunnels that looked as if they were just floating around. it was not as big as we hoped it was either. there are two main tunnels and a few small tanks here and there. you can touch some skates, sharks and sea stars. all in all i felt like it was very short but it was good seeing all of the fish none the less. the staff there seemed to be very excited to be there. at times it was a little excessive though.
author: G T.
